newsitem.title: USA: Clinton names Erskine Bowles as new chief of staff.
newsitem.headline: Clinton names Erskine Bowles as new chief of staff.

text.p: President Bill Clinton, reshaping his administration for his second term, announced on Friday that Erskine Bowles, an investment banker and former top White House official, would be his new chief of staff.

At a White House news conference, Clinton said Bowles, 51, would replace Leon Panetta, a former California congressman. It is the most powerful job in the White House after the president, essentially controlling access to the president and setting much of his agenda.
